headline.main: Cops: Children Locked Inside Room With No Heat, Little Food
headline.print_headline: Cops: Children Locked Inside Room With No Heat, Little Food

docs.snippet: Three emaciated young children were locked inside a room like "caged animals" with no heat and little food, and two of them risked death from abuse and neglect when police and child welfare investigators arrived at their home in mid-December, auth...
docs.lead_paragraph: Three emaciated young children were locked inside a room like "caged animals" with no heat and little food, and two of them risked death from abuse and neglect when police and child welfare investigators arrived at their home in mid-December, authorities said.

headline.main: Soft Is Out! Putin, Trump Force EU to Harden Its Defense
headline.print_headline: Soft Is Out! Putin, Trump Force EU to Harden Its Defense

docs.snippet: Lithuanian President Dalia Grybauskaite gazed imperiously over snow-covered woodlands, the stage for NATO's "Iron Sword" exercise. One of the European Union's toughest leaders — and a karate black belt to boot — she knows that power th...
docs.lead_paragraph: Lithuanian President Dalia Grybauskaite gazed imperiously over snow-covered woodlands, the stage for NATO's "Iron Sword" exercise. One of the European Union's toughest leaders — and a karate black belt to boot — she knows that power these days needs real military hardware to back it up.

headline.main: Gunmen Kidnap Iraqi Journalist in Baghdad, PM Orders Investigation
headline.print_headline: Gunmen Kidnap Iraqi Journalist in Baghdad, PM Orders Investigation

docs.snippet: An Iraqi journalist was kidnapped by unidentified gunmen from her home in Baghdad overnight, police and relatives said on Tuesday, prompting Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi to order an investigation....
docs.lead_paragraph: An Iraqi journalist was kidnapped by unidentified gunmen from her home in Baghdad overnight, police and relatives said on Tuesday, prompting Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi to order an investigation.

headline.main: Volkswagen Recalls 4,481 Cars in Russia: Standards Watchdog
headline.print_headline: Volkswagen Recalls 4,481 Cars in Russia: Standards Watchdog

headline.main: Putin Says New Gas Pipeline Will Boost Annexed Crimea's Economy
headline.print_headline: Putin Says New Gas Pipeline Will Boost Annexed Crimea's Economy

docs.snippet: Russia on Tuesday activated a pipeline carrying Russian gas to Crimea with President Vladimir Putin hailing it as a step that would power economic growth on a peninsula Moscow annexed from Ukraine in 2014....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russia on Tuesday activated a pipeline carrying Russian gas to Crimea with President Vladimir Putin hailing it as a step that would power economic growth on a peninsula Moscow annexed from Ukraine in 2014.

headline.main: Without Obama, Shinzo Abe’s Approach to U.S.-Japan Ties May Be Tested
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Departure Puts Japan’s Alliance With the United States at a Crossroad

docs.snippet: Donald Trump brings uncertainty to the alliance, grumbling about trade and the cost of U.S. military support, and raising the specter of a more confrontational approach to China....
docs.abstract: Japan's relationship to United States and place in Pacific region has been thrown into uncertainty with departure of Pres Obama and impending presidency of Donald Trump, who has promised to destroy Trans-Pacific Partnership championed by Obama and Pers Shinzo Abe and has hinted at more aggressive stance against China.
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump brings uncertainty to the alliance, grumbling about trade and the cost of U.S. military support, and raising the specter of a more confrontational approach to China.

headline.main: Russia Opens Criminal Case Into Official After 77 Die of Alcohol Poisoning
headline.print_headline: Russia Opens Criminal Case Into Official After 77 Die of Alcohol Poisoning

docs.snippet: Russian investigators said on Tuesday they had opened a criminal case into a senior regional official in Siberia after at least 77 people died from drinking bath oil for alcoholic kicks....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russian investigators said on Tuesday they had opened a criminal case into a senior regional official in Siberia after at least 77 people died from drinking bath oil for alcoholic kicks.

headline.main: Hernandez Attorneys Seek Dismissal of Tattoo, Text Evidence
headline.print_headline: Hernandez Attorneys Seek Dismissal of Tattoo, Text Evidence

docs.snippet: Jurors at Aaron Hernandez's upcoming double murder trial shouldn't hear about his tattoos or text messages sent to his sports agent, attorneys for former New England Patriots player told a judge Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jurors at Aaron Hernandez's upcoming double murder trial shouldn't hear about his tattoos or text messages sent to his sports agent, attorneys for former New England Patriots player told a judge Tuesday.
